  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: A fiberboard box was presented to the MEMH spill office with an odor. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered that one of the four metal cans inside spilled its contents. The cans were taped together in a plastic bag with absorbent pads for dunnage. The shipment was placed into a steel salvage package and a new declaration will be obtained for movement.

item.title: Report E-2025070426
item.description:
Report E-2025070426

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-21
  • City: SMYRNA
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: ESTES EXPRESS LINES
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5844
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: Hepaco was dispatched to the site. Upon the contractors arrival, personnel observed that the released material impacted the top of the drums and estimated that one (1) ounce of material was released due to venting through the bung caps from six (6) 55-gallon poly drums. Hepaco personnel wiped down the affected drums and tightened the bungs on them. They also put chemical tape on the bung caps. Muriatic Acid 20 impacted absorbent pads, and PPE were containerized into one (1) 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite. All work was signed off by the ESTES terminal supervisor. The generated waste will remain onsite for the ESTES DGRM team to coordinate disposal.

item.title: Report E-2025060449
item.description:
Report E-2025060449

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-06-19
  • City: KNOXVILLE
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: R & L CARRIERS, INC.
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: On June 19, 2025, one (1) 220-gallon tote of organic peroxide was forked and released approximately two (2) gallons of product to the loading dock floor. R+L Carriers retained Cura Emergency Services, LC who dispatched a crew from American Safety (AS) to remediate the site. AS personnel deployed granular absorbents to the impacted trailer and swept them in with hand tools. Crews patched the damaged tote with duct tape and transferred all product to a new (1) 275-gallon tote to be shipped as product. All spent absorbents, PPE and cleanup debris were containerized in one (1) 55-gallon drum.

  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 0214 ET, XPO notified ERTS of a cargo release at terminal BNA. It was reported that approximately 8-oz of "Provox C (Sodium Carbonate Peroxhydrate)" released from a paper bag due to improper handling. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller and determined that terminal personnel are not capable of cleaning the release with PPE available on site. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 5-ounces of UN3378 Provox C product released to the concrete dock floor due to improper loading. The contractors collected all released material and containerized product into a 30-gallon poly drum and placed impacted PPE and contaminated product into a 30-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

item.description:

  • City: NASHVILLE

  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident

  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 5500
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: At 1831 EDT on 6/9, XPO-BNA contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 2 cups of Lead Battery Acid from 4x 80lb batteries on a trailer. The batteries were improperly loaded and damaged at BNA. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller, and although the terminal can clean the spill, the caller stated that their SCM, Dana Boles, had approved their request for contractor assistance. Contractors arrived onsite and confirmed approximately 2-cups of UN2794 Lead Battery Acid product released to a 4x4 area of the wooden trailer floor, steel grate on trailer floor and concrete beneath trailer due to improper loading. The contractors overpacked the battery into a 30-gallon poly drum and impacted absorbents were placed into 55-gallon poly drum. The waste was staged onsite for terminal personnel to manage.

The shipment consisted of 2 fiberboard boxes, each containing an estimated 21 small cans of paint and 18 glass bottles of primer. 2 bottles of primer shattered, and 1 outer bottle leaked for an unknown cause, resulting in spillage on the other pieces in the same outer package. The damaged package was placed in a salvage drum for disposal and the remaining package awaits an amended shipper's declaration for further transport.

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-05-23
  • City: MEMPHIS
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: Undeclared Shipment with no Release
  • Mode Of Transportation: Air
  • Carrier/Reporter: FEDERAL EXPRESS CORPORATION
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 0
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: During sort operations at the MEMH location a handler observed a cloud coming from a fiberboard box. While investigating the shipment the spill agent discovered a metal canister labeled and UN1977 liquid nitrogen. It was packaged with styrofoam molds top and bottom but the outer fiberboard box was missing DG markings and paperwork required for transit. The shipment is being held at the location for the FAA.

  • Description: At 0425 EDT on 5/23, XPO-NKX contacted ERTS to report a spill of about 1 ounce of "DURACOAT PRE-CATALYZED LACQUER" from a 5gal metal pail onto the trailer floor. The pail was damaged in transit from NHN. ERTS reviewed the SDS with the caller who felt comfortable cleaning the spill with terminal-issued PPE. No absorbent was necessary. ERTS generated waste ID: 238741-1

item.title: Report E-2025060418
item.description:
Report E-2025060418

Identified by scraper @ 2025-07-23T00:58:10+00:00

  • Incident Date: 2025-04-18
  • City: MANCHESTER
  • State: TN
  • Report Type: A hazardous material incident
  • Mode Of Transportation: Highway
  • Carrier/Reporter: CIRCLE K
  • Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Hazmat Injuries: 0
  • Non-Hazmat Fatalities: 0
  • Total Amount Of Damages: 6000
  • Serious Incident Ind: No
  • Description: The spill consists of approximately 5 gallons of gasoline, which was released when a Circle K fuel carrier was making a delivery, and there was an error during delivery, causing the fuel to bubble up from the ground and spill out onto the asphalt. The store placed down rags and kitty litter to contain the spill, and they stated the majority of the fuel has already dried up. Contractor collected granular absorbents to one 55-gallon drum and removed drum from site for proper disposal.
